email.description: Contact e-mail pertaining to the mod

irc.description: IRC channel pertaining to the mod. Must be of a valid URL format

homepage.description: Project or user homepage. Must be a valid HTTP/HTTPS address

issues.description: Project issue tracker. Must be a valid HTTP/HTTPS address

sources.description: Project source code repository. Must be a valid URL

environment.description: The environment where this mod will be loaded

file.description: A string value pointing to a path from the root of the JAR to a nested JAR which should be loaded alongside the outer mod JAR

oneOf.description: Multiple version ranges that are combined with an "OR" relationship - only one of the ranges needs to match

versionRange.description:
A version range that matches versions. The following variants are supported:

- A single asterisk matches any version.
- Ranges following NPM semver specification including >=, >, =, <, <=, X-ranges (1.x), tilde ranges (fixed minor) and caret ranges (fixed major).
- Additionally exact string matches will always be performed.
versionRange.x-intellij-html-description:
A version range or an array of those that match versions. The following variants are supported:

  • * matches any version.
  • Ranges following NPM semver specification:
    • >=, >, =, < and <
    • X-ranges to specify variable components, e.g. 1.x
    • tilde ranges that allow patch version changes, e.g. ~1.2.3
    • caret ranges that allow up to minor version changes, e.g. ^1.2.3
  • Exact string matches are always performed as well.

If an array of ranges is used, they're treated as in an "OR" relationship - only one of the ranges needs to match.
versionRange.markdownDescription:
A version range or an array of those that match versions. The following variants are supported:

- `*` matches any version.
- Ranges following [NPM semver specification](https://docs.npmjs.com/about-semantic-versioning):
  - `>=`, `>`, `=`, `<` and `<=`
  - X-ranges to specify variable components, e.g. `1.x`
  - tilde ranges that allow patch version changes, e.g. `~1.2.3`
  - caret ranges that allow up to minor version changes, e.g. `^1.2.3`
- Exact string matches are always performed as well.

If an array of ranges is used, they're treated as in an "OR" relationship - only one of the ranges needs to match.

schemaVersion.description: The version of the fabric.mod.json schema

main.description: The entrypoint for all environments (classes must implement ModInitializer)

client.description: The entrypoint for the client environment (classes must implement ClientModInitializer)

server.description: The entrypoint for the server environment (classes must implement DedicatedServerModInitializer)

entrypoints.description: The entrypoints used by this mod

jars.description: Contains an array of nestedJar objects

languageAdapters.description: A string→string dictionary, connecting namespaces to LanguageAdapter implementations

oneOf.description: Path to mixin file from the root of the JAR

config.description: Path to mixin file from the root of the JAR

accessWidener.description: Path to an access widener definition file

depends.description: id→versionRange map for dependencies. Failure to meet these causes a hard failure

recommends.description: id→versionRange map for dependencies. Failure to meet these causes a soft failure (warning)

suggests.description: id→versionRange map for dependencies. Are not matched and are mainly used as metadata

conflicts.description: id→versionRange map for dependencies. A successful match causes a soft failure (warning)

breaks.description: id→versionRange map for dependencies. A successful match causes a hard failure

oneOf.description: The path to a single .PNG file from the root of the JAR
A string→string dictionary, where the keys conform to widths of each PNG file, and the values are said files' paths

additionalProperties.description: The path to a single .PNG file from the root of the JAR

custom.description: A map of namespace:id→value for custom data fields.
